properties.areaDesc: North Oregon Coast; South Washington Coast; Central Oregon Coast
properties.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 10 at 3:05PM PST until January 11 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Large waves and dangerous surf conditions. Breakers to 30
to 35 ft.

* WHERE...South Washington, North Oregon Coast and Central
Oregon Coasts.

* WHEN...From 1 AM to 4 PM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Destructive waves may wash over beaches, jetties, and
other structures unexpectedly. People can be swept off rocks and
jetties and drown while observing high surf. Severe beach
erosion may destroy coastal properties and buildings. Higher
than normal water run-up is expected on beaches and low-lying
shoreline.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very high tides late Saturday morning to
early afternoon will result in even higher wave run-up.
properties.instruction:
A High Surf Warning means that high surf may affect beaches,
producing rip currents, sneaker waves and beach erosion. Stay well
back from the water's edge and be alert for exceptionally high
waves.

Keep away from large logs on the beach. Water running up on the
beach can lift or roll logs which can injure or kill someone
caught in their path.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 4 PM PST SATURDAY
